title.narrative: HEALTH AND NUTRITION COVID-19 RESPONSE

description.narrative: UNICEF has technically assisted the Dominican government to respond to the emergency generated by the Covid-19 Pandemic and mobilized Dominican society to avoid contagion, which contributes to Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition, Early Detection And Treatment Of Malnutrition (Covid), Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Safe And Equitable Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Services And Practices, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions (Covid), Water, Sanitation And Hygiene Systems And Empowerment Of Communities. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2022, pregnant women, newborns and adolescents will access high-quality health services.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTERIO DE SALUD PUBLICA Y ASISTENCIA SOCIAL
PROCURADURIA GENERAL DE LA REPUBLIC DOMINICANA

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: UNICEF has technically assisted the Dominican government to respond to the emergency generated by the Covid-19 Pandemic andmobilized Dominican society to avoid contagion

description.narrative: UNICEF’s COVID-19 pandemic response mobilized GOs, NGOs and UN agencies to reach the most vulnerable population groups. In this context, UNICEF is coordinating the efforts and resources from the Vice-presidency, the MOH, 24 NGOs, UNCHR and IOM to vaccinate vulnerable population groups against COVID-19The power to involve GOs and NGOs in the wellbeing of children has progressively mitigated the impact of the pandemic among19,946 children under 5 and 4,073 pregnant and lactating women living in 26 out of 32 provinces wherethe Plan to Reduce Acute Malnutrition is being implemented throughout the MOH, NHS, INAIPI, and 15 NGOs. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:12/01/2022
